title.narrative: POLICY, STRATEGY AND COORDINATION

description.narrative: By the end of 2018, the National Education Sector plan is implemented and significant progress is made on major reforms, sector coordination is strengthened and planning of the last phase of the ESP is on progress in order to improve quality and efficiency by better governance of the sector and reduced repetition and dropout rates., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2010-2018 - Outcome 1 / Education: School and preschool-aged children (4-12 years) have access to quality education and achieve universal primary education, and adolescents in and out of school have strengthened skills in the area of HIV / AIDS prevention, reproductive health and peacebuilding by 2018.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2018, the National Education Sector plan is implemented and significant progress is made on major reforms, sectorcoordination is strengthened and planning of the last phase of the ESP is on progress in order to improve quality and efficiency bybetter governance of the sector and reduced repetition and dropout rates.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to strengthen the enabling environment to support the implementation of sector Policies/Plans. UNICEF was able to roll out an inclusive and participatory policy dialogue through a strengthened sector coordination mechanism, while revitalized the Local Education Group. This resulted in the development of a new Education Transition Plan. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - Availability of an Education Management Information System that transparently feeds findings back to communities or school management committees - score (1-4), see guidance
Availability of annual education statistical update
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education sector analysis, financial simulation model or medium term expenditure framework developed with UNICEF support
National MIS produces quaterly reports / dashboards on performance against key indicators for all districts within 6 months

actual.value: 2018:Yearly reports have been developed, timeliness is improving

title.narrative: National education sector plan/policies supports a minimum package of gender-responsive teaching and learning
